intro: Orlaya pumila, commonly known as the dwarf orlaya, is a small annual herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters and features slender, branching stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in clusters, usually from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often arranged alternately along the stem. Orlaya pumila is often found in disturbed soils and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
